title: Secure Password Manager
description: Build a command-line password manager that implements industry-standard cryptographic practices. This project focuses on secure key derivation, proper encryption/decryption, and secure password storage. Students will learn to implement PBKDF2 or Argon2 for key derivation, AES-256 for encryption, and proper key management techniques. The password manager should support storing, retrieving, updating, and deleting password entries while maintaining confidentiality and integrity.
requirements: Implement secure master password handling with PBKDF2 or Argon2 key derivation (minimum 100,000 iterations)
Use AES-256-GCM or ChaCha20-Poly1305 for encrypting password entries
Generate cryptographically secure random passwords with configurable length and character sets
Store encrypted passwords with proper salt and IV/nonce handling
Implement secure memory handling to prevent password leakage
Add password strength validation and enforcement
Implement automatic clipboard clearing after password retrieval
Create comprehensive documentation explaining cryptographic choices
Include unit tests for all cryptographic operations
Handle edge cases and error conditions securely (no information leakage)

title: Secure REST API Server
description: Develop a secure REST API server implementing multiple layers of defense. This project emphasizes authentication, authorization, input validation, output encoding, rate limiting, and secure session management. Students will build an API for a simple application (e.g., task management, note-taking) while implementing OWASP Top 10 defenses. The focus is on preventing injection attacks, implementing proper authentication with JWT or session tokens, validating all inputs, and protecting against common web vulnerabilities.
requirements: Implement secure user authentication with JWT or secure session tokens
Add role-based access control (RBAC) with at least 3 permission levels
Validate and sanitize all user inputs to prevent injection attacks
Implement parameterized queries or ORM to prevent SQL injection
Add rate limiting per endpoint and per user to prevent abuse
Implement CORS policies, CSP headers, and security headers (HSTS, X-Frame-Options)
Use HTTPS/TLS with proper certificate validation
Implement secure password storage with bcrypt, scrypt, or Argon2
Add comprehensive logging for security events (without logging sensitive data)
Implement proper error handling without information disclosure
Add input validation middleware with whitelist approach
Include security testing suite (authentication bypass, injection attempts, XSS)

title: Security Audit and Vulnerability Assessment Tool
description: Create a defensive security tool that performs static code analysis and configuration auditing to identify common security vulnerabilities. This project teaches students to think like both attackers and defenders by building automated security checks. The tool should scan codebases or configurations for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, insecure cryptographic practices, hardcoded secrets, and misconfigurations. Students will implement pattern matching, AST parsing, and rule-based detection while learning about secure development practices.
requirements: Implement static analysis for at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, Java, or similar)
Detect common vulnerabilities: SQL injection patterns, XSS vulnerabilities, hardcoded secrets, weak cryptography
Scan for insecure dependencies with known CVEs using vulnerability databases
Check for security misconfigurations (debug mode enabled, default credentials, exposed endpoints)
Implement detection for insecure deserialization and XXE vulnerabilities
Generate detailed security reports with severity ratings (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
Provide remediation recommendations for each finding
Support multiple output formats (JSON, HTML report, CSV)
Implement configurable rule sets and custom rule creation
Add false positive suppression mechanisms
Include performance optimization for large codebases
Create comprehensive documentation with examples of detected vulnerabilities
